moves.1. Nf3: The Reti Opening: my favorite hypermodern approach as white.
moves.1... Nc6: I expected Nf6 or d5, but this move is new. Wouldn’t recommend it.
moves.2. g3: I continue developing slowing and fianchettoing.
moves.2... d5: Now controlling the centre. I think maybe d6 would also be good because the knight can then move to e4.
moves.3... e5: Now Anu has complete control of the centre, but I have a nice developed kingside.
moves.6. h3 Bd7: Bf5 would have been better, but Anu wanted the queen behind the bishop for the threat of Bxh3 later on. However, I still recommend Bf5.
moves.8. Kh2: Note that if white went another move, and allowed Bxh3, the follow-up could be like 8. ... Bxh3 9. g4 Bxg7 10. Kxg7, leaving black a pawn up. On the other hand, if white went g4 immediately, the kingside would be slightly more exposed with the dangerous h2-b8 diagonal open to attack.
moves.8... Nf6 9. Nb3: And so the harassment of the black DSB has begun.
moves.9... Bb6 10. a4 a5 11. c4 d4 12. c5 Ba7: Notice how horribly placed black’s DSB is.
moves.13. Qc2 Be6: ! This threatens 14. ... Bxb3 15. Qxb3 Bxc5 and the DSB is back in the game.
moves.14. Bd2: Ra3 would have been more safe. I was threatening h5 but didn’t realize that AFTER the combo I mentioned earlier, the rook would be guarding that pawn as well as the knight.
moves.15... Nxa5 16. Bxa5 Ng5: More pressure on h3. My heart is pounding at this point.
moves.17. Ng1: The only safe move I could think of.
moves.19. c6: Now the DSB is free, but there is a threat along the long h1-a8 diagonal.
moves.20. Bb4 g5 21. Nf3 f6 22. Qd2 Rg8 23. Ba: With the immediate threat of Qe7#. Black should have castled way earlier to avoid this.
moves.24... Rg7: Now the key is the Nh7.
moves.26. Bxd5 gxh4 27. Bg8: Ha-ha! Now black is in a real pickle. If the rook moves off the 7th rank, you’re doomed; if your knight is taken off the board, Qf8 kills you.
moves.28. fxg3: !! Now the f1 rook has the whole f-file to itself!
moves.29... Nxf8 30. Qxf8#: Whew! That was an amazing, exciting game between Anu and I. My heart was POUNDING LIKE CRAZY! Hope you enjoyed!

gameName: A confusing beginning... and an exciting finish!
